comment: He is a great professor. Super sweet, nice, and tries to be funny when he can. Very understanding and not a super difficult to get a good grade. All quizzes and test are online and open book due to MATLab constantly changing, he does not require memorization. I had a great time and would definitely recommend!

This class is pretty easy. All the lectures are youtube videos but the questions on quizzes are very easy. The tests are just a bunch of questions from quizzes. The final project is very easy and took me about 3 hours to complete. The professor isnt the best teacher but the class is quite easy and I ended up okay.

2 Exams, 12 Quizzes: only open for 20 hours. ChatGPT helps with learning, especially if you're new to coding. Learn MATLAB early as one project requires real use. This is just my personal opinion, not advice to break academic rules. Use tools responsibly and follow your school's integrity policies.

Took him for the once a week class and at least in 2024 he had no lockdown for tests. There is a project that is not hard but just annoying (have to CAD and print a model and record a PP). Most annoying thing is that he sets everything due at 10 PM.

Exam 1-3 60%
Project 10%
Quiz 20%
Attendance 10%

I took him for a 100% online course with no scheduled meeting dates. Tests are easy, quiz once a week. The problem is he REQUIRED us to attend seminars on short notice, and go on a tour to a nuclear facility that was up to 3 hours away. Not to mention most of these events overlapped with my other courses. I do not recommend taking him online.

DO NOT TAKE HIM ONLINE. He required 6 in person seminars for a 100% asynchronous class and a tour of a Powerplant where the closest was 3 hours away. He has no lecture videos and requires you to read off PowerPoints and textbook in order to learn the info. He had completely ruined my interest in Nuclear engineering.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took Dr. Farfan's class at 9:00am and would only show up for exams, he makes the class fairly straightforward and easy. Nuclear Engineering is a fascinating subject as well. Our exams were open note as well. I would recommend him just make sure you do not mind getting to campus early.

Dr. Farfan was a great professor for ENGR 3501. The homework was somewhat difficult. Other than that, lectures were done very well, and he would bring in companies that would give information on their nuclear engineering internships and jobs. The end-of-year project is to 3D print a nuclear reactor design, and it was graded somewhat easily.
I had gone through one of the worst semesters of my life and it effected me in school. Dr. Farfan helped me get back on track
One of my favorite professors at KSU. Great lectures, tests are based of HW but easier. Put in genuine effort and you're guaranteed an A.

Easy to work with. He listens to your problem and great lecture. Definitely would take him again. He will help you if you need help. He will also provide info about jobs and internships. Also exam similar to hw

Amazing professor! Highly knowledgeable and passionate about what he teaches. Though he is always busy being so heavily involved in the Engineering Department and the nuclear minor, he will always find time to help his students.
The homework is very easy and the exams are not any more difficult. No complaints.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took him for MATLAB online and it was a pretty easy class. You have assignments once or twice a week and a test here or there. There is a final project which requires you to apply your matlab knowledge to an engineering problem, Just choose something you are good at and it should be easy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: I had Dr. Farfan for Thermo this semester and he was amazing. The way he lectured made a potentially difficult class interesting and enjoyable. After the shutdown he was less hands on but adjusted the level of tests and homework accordingly. 10/10 would take again for any class he teaches.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This is my first time rating a professor. It was an online class and It was kinda easy. He was so nice at grading and not that strict at getting hw late cuz I turned the Project and one of the Assignment late and he accepted. The only problem he got he'd respond to ur email in a day or 2. Just an easy A class for real.

For class he's pretty straightforward. He explains the concepts well and test you on exactly what you learn, not nothing random. This professor really cares about his students. He's understanding and he also tries to give a lot of opportunities for jobs/interns/co-ops throughout the semester.

Great guy, If you have the opportunity to take him, do it. I took him for both ME 1311 and ENGR 3501 and hes been great both times. If you are in his Mat lab Class make sure to put extra effort into your case study you might get rewarded :).

He's very helpful. This was a summer class so things progressed quickly. He want's people to understand the material. You just have to ask for help. The only problem is he takes a while to grade assignments and tests. It's 3 days before grades are due and he has 4 in-class, 1 test and final projects to grade. I'm most likely going to get an A.
